caseName: California Fruit Growers Exchange v. Sunkist Drinks, Inc.
caseNameFull: CALIFORNIA FRUIT GROWERS EXCHANGE v. SUNKIST DRINKS, Inc.

opinions.snippet:
COLEMAN, District Judge.
In 1907 the plaintiff, the California Fruit Growers Exchange, adopted as a trade-mark the word “Sunkist” in the marketing of fresh citrus fruits throughout the country, and established rigorous standards of quality for all sold under that brand. The word has not only been featured in advertising, but has been printed prominently on containers, on wrappers, and even on the individual pieces of fruit.

caseName: West v. Allen

opinions.snippet:
MEMORANDUM OPINION

INGE PRYTZ JOHNSON, District Judge.
This action seeks habeas corpus relief with respect to Petitioner Geoffrey Todd West’s (“West” or “Petitioner”) state court conviction and death sentence on a charge of capital murder. See 28 U.S.C. § 2254 (2006). All of the claims have been briefed to the Court, and the petition is ready for adjudication.
